sgfx::Bitmap Class Reference

Documentation

This class implements a bitmap and is powered by the sgfx library.

Member Function Documentation

int sgfx::Bitmap::alloc ( sg_size_t  w,
sg_size_t  h 
)

Allocate memory for the bitmap data

virtual bool sgfx::Bitmap::busy ( )
inlinevirtual

This method is designated as an interface for classes that inherit Bitmap and use refresh() to copy the bitmap memory to a physical device. The default implementation always returns false.

The bitmap should not be modified while a refresh is in progress to prevent a frame from being partially copied.

See refresh() for an example.

Returns
True if the refresh() is still in progress, false if the bitmap can be modified again
static size_t sgfx::Bitmap::calc_size ( int  w,
int  h 
)
inlinestatic

Return the size of a bitmap of specified size

size_t sgfx::Bitmap::calc_size ( ) const
inlinevirtual

size() is the current size of the bitmap. capacity() will return total memory allocated for the size of the object

Returns
The effective memory size of the bitmap

Reimplemented from var::Data.

void sgfx::Bitmap::free ( )

Free memory associated with bitmap (auto freed on ~Bitmap)

virtual void sgfx::Bitmap::refresh ( )
inlinevirtual

This method is designated as an interface for classes that inherit Bitmap to copy the bitmap to a physical device (such as an LCD). The implementation in this class is simple an empty method. Here is an example:

LcdDev lcd; //this class inherits bitmap and re-implments refresh()
lcd.clear(); //clear the bitmap in memory
lcd.refresh(); //copy the memory to the physical device (or notify the underlying driver that it is time to copy)

Reimplemented in hal::LcdObject.

int sgfx::Bitmap::set_bitmap ( const Bitmap &  bitmap,
sg_point_t  p 
)
inline

This method sets a bitmap on to the current bitmap. It only has bit level positioning but is slower than the copy() method

Parameters
bitmapThe bitmap to set
xThe x location to start copying
yThe y location to start copying
postrue to set pixels and false to clear them
Returns
Zero on success
